verses.text: 耶穌基督降生（參太1:18~25）那時，有諭旨從凱撒奧古士督頒發下來，叫普天下的人登記戶口。

words.note: Often used for the birth of a divine or significant figure.
Abbreviation for 馬太福音 (Gospel of Matthew).
A formal term for an official proclamation, usually from an emperor.
To formally release or announce a decree, law, or prize.
Directional complement indicating movement downwards towards the speaker.
Literally 'all under heaven'.
Refers to the act of registering households for an official count or census.

verses.text: 這是第一次戶口登記，是在居里紐作敘利亞總督的時候舉行的。

words.note: Refers to the specific event or system of census registration.
A high-ranking official governing a province or region.
To formally organize or carry out an event.

verses.text: 眾人各歸各城去登記戶口。

words.note: Refers to the act of registering households for an official count or census.

verses.text: 約瑟本是大衛家族的人，也從加利利的拿撒勒上猶太去，到了大衛的城伯利恆，
與所聘之妻馬利亞一同登記戶口。那時馬利亞的身孕已經重了。

words.note: Indicates the object of the verb or what is acted upon.
A classical Chinese particle, often equivalent to modern '的'.
Refers to the act of registering households for an official count or census.
A formal or traditional term for pregnancy.
Here, implies the pregnancy was far along or difficult.

verses.text: 他們在那裡的時候，馬利亞的產期到了，
生了頭胎兒子，用布包著，放在馬槽裡，因為客店裡沒有地方。
天使向牧羊人報喜信在伯利恆的郊外，有一些牧人在夜間看守羊群。

words.note: A verb-object compound, 'report joyful news'.

verses.text: 主的一位使者站在他們旁邊，主的榮光四面照著他們，他們就非常害怕。

words.note: Refers to God or Jesus in biblical context.

verses.text: 天使說：「不要怕！看哪！我報給你們大喜的信息，是關於萬民的：

words.note: Common biblical exclamation, combining 'look' with a particle.
Here, nominalizes the preceding phrase into 'that which concerns all people'.

verses.text: 今天在大衛的城裡，為你們生了救主，就是主基督。
你們要找到一個嬰孩，包著布，臥在馬槽裡，那就是記號了。」

words.note: Refers to the feeding trough used as a crib for Jesus.

verses.text: 忽然有一大隊天兵，同那天使一起讚美　神說：

words.definition: a large host, a large group

words.note: Lit. 'heavenly soldiers'.
Lit. 'heavenly messenger'.
In Chinese Bibles, often preceded by a space for reverence.

verses.text: 「在至高之處，榮耀歸與　神！在地上，平安歸與他所喜悅的人！」

words.note: Classical Chinese particle, similar to 'de' 的.

words.definition: to be given to, belong to
words.note: A classical expression meaning 'to return to' or 'to be attributed to'.
In Chinese Bibles, often preceded by a space for reverence.

words.definition: to be given to, belong to
words.note: A classical expression meaning 'to return to' or 'to be attributed to'.
Indicates the following verb is being acted upon or is the object of attention.

words.definition: to be pleased with, to favor

verses.text: 眾天使離開他們升天去了，那些牧人彼此說：「我們往伯利恆去，看看主所指示我們已經成就的事。」

words.note: Lit. 'heavenly messenger'.
Lit. 'herdsmen'.
Reduplication of verb indicates a casual or brief action.
Indicates the following verb is being acted upon or is the object of attention.

verses.text: 他們急忙去了，找到馬利亞、約瑟和那臥在馬槽裡的嬰孩。

words.note: Verb-complement structure indicating successful finding.
More formal than 躺 (tǎng).
Formal term for baby; 嬰兒 (yīng'ér) is more common.

verses.text: 他們見過以後，就把天使對他們論這孩子的話傳開了。

words.note: Lit. 'heavenly messenger'.
More formal or literary than 說 (shuō) or 談 (tán).

verses.text: 聽見的人，都希奇牧人所說的事。

words.note: Forms a noun phrase from a verb, e.g., 'those who heard'.
More formal or literary than 感到驚訝 (gǎndào jīngyà).
Forms a noun phrase from a verb, often indicating 'what was done'.

verses.text: 馬利亞把這一切放在心裡，反覆思想。

words.note: Figurative meaning, referring to one's thoughts or memory.
More formal or literary than 一再 (yīzài).
Can also be a noun meaning 'thought'.

verses.text: 牧人因為聽見的和看見的，正像天使對他們所說的一樣，就回去了，把榮耀讚美歸與　神。

words.note: More formal or biblical than 給 (gěi).
An em-space often precedes 'God' in Chinese Bibles for reverence.

verses.text: 滿了八天，替孩子行割禮的時候，就給他起名叫耶穌，就是他成胎之前，天使所起的。

words.note: 割禮 is specifically 'circumcision'.
Literally 'heavenly messenger'.

verses.text: 在聖殿奉獻耶穌滿了潔淨的日子，他們就按著摩西的律法，帶孩子上耶路撒冷去，奉獻給主。
正如主的律法所記：「所有頭生的男孩，都當稱為聖歸給主。」
又照著主的律法所說的獻上祭物，就是一對斑鳩或兩隻雛鴿。
在耶路撒冷有一個人，名叫西面，這人公義虔誠，一向期待以色列的安慰者來到，又有聖靈在他身上。
聖靈啟示他，在死前必得見主所應許的基督，

words.note: Indicates a passive or emphasizes the object of a verb.

verses.text: 他又受聖靈感動進了聖殿。那時，耶穌的父母抱著孩子進來，要按著律法的規矩為他行禮。

words.note: Combined '進' (enter) and '了' (aspect particle).
Combined '抱' (hold) and '著' (aspect particle).
Combined '按' (press, follow) and '著' (aspect particle).

verses.text: 西面就把他接到手上，稱頌　神說：

words.note: Used as a locative particle with nouns.

verses.text: 「主啊，現在照你的話，釋放僕人平平安安地去吧！

words.note: AABB reduplication for emphasis; means 'very safely/peacefully'.
Indicates suggestion, command, or agreement.

verses.text: 因我的眼睛已經看見你的救恩，

words.note: Lit. 'saving grace'.

verses.text: 就是你在萬民面前所預備的，

words.note: Connects an assertion with its explanation.
Refers to all humanity, often non-Israelites.
Forms a nominal phrase with the following verb.

verses.text: 為要作外族人啟示的光，和你民以色列的榮耀。」

words.definition: in order to, for the purpose of

words.note: Refers to people of other nations, distinct from Israel.

verses.text: 他父母因論到他的這些話而希奇。
西面給他們祝福，對他母親馬利亞說：「看哪！這孩子被立，要叫以色列中許多人跌倒，許多人興起，又要成為反對的目標，

words.definition: to be established, to be set

words.note: Often used as a suffix indicating 'within' or 'among'.
Often used figuratively for spiritual or moral falling.

words.definition: to rise up, to be raised
words.note: Often used figuratively for spiritual or social rising.

verses.text: （你自己的心也會被刀刺透，）這樣，許多人心中的意念就要被揭露出來。」

words.note: Used as a suffix to mean 'within the heart'.
Indicates a logical consequence or immediate result.
Directional complement indicating emergence or revelation.

verses.text: 又有一個女先知，就是亞拿，是亞設支派法內利的女兒。她已經上了年紀，從童女出嫁，和丈夫住了七年，
就寡居了，直到八十四歲（「就寡居了，直到八十四歲」或譯：「就寡居了八十四年」）。她沒有離開過聖殿，以禁食和禱告晝夜事奉主。

words.note: More formal or literary than '用'.

verses.text: 就在那時候，她前來稱謝　神，並且向期待耶路撒冷蒙救贖的眾人，講論孩子的事。

words.note: The leading space is a traditional sign of respect in Chinese Bibles.

verses.text: 他們按著主的律法辦完一切，就回加利利，到自己的城拿撒勒去了。
孩子漸漸長大，強壯起來，充滿智慧，有　神的恩典在他身上。

words.definition: to rise up; indicates start of action/state
to be full of, filled with

words.note: The leading space is a traditional sign of respect in Chinese Bibles.

verses.text: 孩童耶穌上耶路撒冷過節每年逾越節，他父母都上耶路撒冷去。

words.note: A major Jewish festival.

verses.text: 當他十二歲時，他們按著節期的慣例，照常上去。
過完了節，他們回去的時候，孩童耶穌仍留在耶路撒冷，他父母卻不知道，
還以為他在同行的人中間。走了一天，就在親戚和熟人中找他，
沒有找到，就轉回耶路撒冷找他。
過了三天，才發現他在聖殿裡，坐在教師中間，一面聽，一面問。

words.note: Refers to a holy building for worship.
Used as a locative suffix with nouns.
Used in the '一面...一面...' structure for simultaneous actions.
Used in the '一面...一面...' structure for simultaneous actions.

verses.text: 所有聽見他的人，都希奇他的聰明和應對。

words.note: 見 acts as a resultative complement, meaning 'to perceive successfully'.
Here, it nominalizes the preceding phrase to mean 'those who heard him'.
Often used in biblical texts to express wonder or astonishment.
Refers to one's ability to respond or retort appropriately.

verses.text: 他父母見了，非常驚奇，他母親說：「孩子，為甚麼這樣對待我們呢？你看，你父親和我都很擔心地在找你呢！」

words.note: Lit. 'not common', thus 'extraordinary'.
Idiomatic expression, often used to draw attention.
Lit. 'to carry a burden in one's heart'.
Connects an adjective/adverb to a verb.

verses.text: 他說：「為甚麼找我呢？你們不知道我必須在我父的家裡嗎？（「在我父的家裡嗎？」或譯：「以我父的事為念嗎？」）」

words.note: Formal or respectful term for father.
Formal or respectful term for father.
Commonly used in Bible translations for alternative readings.
Classical Chinese preposition, often replaced by '用' in modern Mandarin.
Formal or respectful term for father.
Used in the '以...為...' structure, meaning 'to take...as...' or 'to consider...to be...'.
Here, meaning 'a matter of concern' or 'a thing to be mindful of'.

verses.text: 但他們不明白他所說的話。

words.note: Forms a noun phrase from a verb, indicating the object or result of the action.
Combines with '所說' to form a nominal phrase 'what he said'.

verses.text: 他就同他們下去，回到拿撒勒，並且順從他們。他母親把這一切事，都存在心裡。

words.note: Directional compound verb
Here '存' means 'store', '在' acts as a resultative complement.
Lit. 'inside the heart'

verses.text: 耶穌的智慧和身量，以及　神和人對他的喜愛，都不斷增長。

words.note: Indicates reverence space for 'God'
Lit. 'not broken'
